result.execSummary:
Norman Dale Bourgord was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Norman Dale Bourgord was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Extradition-Arrest Prior to Requisition-DeKalb County, AL

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court.  Gwanny J. Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed on motion of the state.

Defendant Norman Dale Bourgord in court in custody with attorney Walter H. Isaacson.  Richard J. Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives extradition. Bond Revoked.  Review hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:00 am.
from defendant; sent to Judge - Filed

Defendant Norman Dale Bourgord in court in custody with attorney Walter H. Isaacson.  Richard J. Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Norman Dale Bourgord in court in custody with attorney Walter H. Isaacson.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to Jury Trial waived by Defendant freely and voluntarily; State consent.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 08:00 am.
to attend Memorial service upon approval of the RCSD

Defendant Norman Dale Bourgord in court with attorney Walter H. Isaacson.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes Sheriff Dept. to make decision re: furlough for memorial service.
Status conference on September 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Norman Dale Bourgord in court with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
